title: Brook's Story Mirrors Joy Boy's Journey
theoryText: Many fans believe that Brook's backstory is a modern-day retelling of what happened to Joy Boy at the close of the Void Century. The parallels include: a crew making promises, tragic deaths, and one survivor carrying on the legacy. Brook's story of waiting decades to fulfill a promise to Laboon may mirror Joy Boy's promise that created the One Piece treasure itself.
author: One Piece Community (GameRant compilation)
spoilerDescription: Theory connects Brook's story to endgame One Piece mysteries and the Void Century
evidence: Brook's crew made a promise they couldn't fulfill before dying
The theme of inherited will is central to both stories
Brook's 50-year wait parallels the centuries-long wait for Joy Boy's return
Both involve musical/cultural elements (Binks' Sake vs Ancient Kingdom)

title: Brook as Schrödinger's Cat - Neither Alive nor Dead
theoryText: Some fans theorize that Brook exists in a quantum state similar to Schrödinger's Cat - simultaneously alive and dead. His existence as a living skeleton defies normal life/death categorization. This theory suggests Brook may be immune to certain death-based abilities or may have unique interactions with other supernatural powers in the One Piece world.
author: Fandom Wire
spoilerDescription: Discusses Brook's unique existential state and potential future implications
evidence: Brook can be 'killed' but his soul persists
He exhibits properties of both living and dead beings
His Devil Fruit defies the normal death limitation
He can interact with souls and spiritual entities
counterEvidence: Brook states he can die a second time permanently
He has normal biological limitations despite being a skeleton

title: The Florian Triangle as a Natural Devil Fruit Power Amplifier
theoryText: Some fans theorize that the Florian Triangle's supernatural fog may be caused by or amplified by Devil Fruit powers. The region's mysterious properties - ships disappearing, supernatural fog, giant creatures - could be the result of Gecko Moria's shadow powers interacting with the natural environment, or possibly an ancient Devil Fruit user's power still affecting the area.
author: One Piece Fan Community
spoilerDescription: Involves Thriller Bark arc events and Gecko Moria's powers
evidence: The fog has existed for centuries, predating Moria
Over 100 ships disappear annually in this specific region
Giant creatures with glowing red eyes inhabit the fog
The supernatural atmosphere seems concentrated in this area
counterEvidence: The wiki states ships were disappearing before Moria arrived
No direct evidence of Devil Fruit involvement in the fog itself

title: The Mysterious Barrel as Moria's Lure
theoryText: Fans theorize that the mysterious barrel that triggers a flare is deliberately placed by Gecko Moria or his crew as a lure to attract ships into the Florian Triangle. The flare serves as a signal that allows them to track and capture vessels in the fog, explaining how they've been so successful in stealing shadows from passing crews.
author: One Piece Community Discussion
spoilerDescription: Minor spoilers about Thriller Bark arc mechanics
evidence: The barrel appears conveniently before they enter the Florian Triangle
The flare could serve as a tracking beacon
Moria's operation requires capturing ships efficiently
The timing is too convenient to be coincidence
counterEvidence: Not explicitly confirmed in the anime
Could be a natural hazard or prank from another source
